feed.title: Do You Realize That Ke$ha Is On The Flaming Lips' Next Record?! (Same Goes For Bon Iver, Erykah Badu)
feed.subtitle: Ke$ha and The Flaming Lips teamed up for the Oklahoma band's upcoming record. The disc, expected to arrive on Record Store Day, will also reportedly feature collaborations from Bon Iver and Erykah Badu.

entry.title: Do You Realize That Ke$ha Is On The Flaming Lips' Next Record?! (Same Goes For Bon Iver, Erykah Badu)

link.Abstract: Ke$ha and The Flaming Lips teamed up for the Oklahoma band's upcoming record. The disc, expected to arrive on Record Store Day, will also reportedly feature collaborations from Bon Iver and Erykah Badu.

content.div:
She's been known to make out with unicorns. She once pissed in a sink with Lily Allen, and gargling with whiskey is part of her daily dental routine. Still, we'd never call Ke$ha crazy. We'll leave that to The Flaming Lips' Wayne Coyne -- a musician who thinks nothing of recording a 24-hour-long song, then packaging it inside a real human skull -- a guy who definitely knows from cocoa puffs.

"She's crazy.. But shit!!!!she can really fuckin SING!!!" Coyne Tweeted over the weekend. And while you may have thought the same thing after stumbling upon K-Dollah's cover of Bob Dylan's "Don't Think Twice It's Alright," Coyne comes by his opinion more intimately. The Flaming Lips and Ke$ha have been recording together (that previously mentioned Tweet even included a short clip of Ke$ha wailing in studio), and according to Pitchfork, their collaboration will appear on a new Flaming Lips disc slated to arrive on Record Store Day (April 21).

Coyne has diligently Tweeted through the K-Dollar collab: he's shared video of Ke$ha tattooing some guy, Ke$ha besting the Lips' Steven Drozd in a screaming contest, Ke$ha "singing about taking acid as the world ends." There's also clip where his finger probes a jar of glitter (presumably Ke$ha's).

And even though Coyne told Pitchfork last fall that his Grammy winning psych-rock band would be into working with the "TiK ToK" hitmaker, collaborating with one mere pop-princess hardly seems ambitious enough. This is a band, after all, that released nearly a dozen EPs in 2011, several of them collaborative (and many of them released as hard-drives encased in gummy candy).

Pitchfork reports that The Flaming Lips' Record Store Day disc will also feature artists including Bon Iver, Erykah Badu, Nick Cave, Yoko Ono and Neon Indian -- and Coyne has been just as good about Tweeting teasers of some of those partnerships as he was with Ke$ha.

Check out brief clips of The Flaming Lips' work with Bon Iver and Badu below.

As for Ke$ha, the pop star is thought to be working on the follow-up to 2010’s Animal. As she told Entertainment Weekly, she expects the record will be ready in the second half of 2012.

Bon Iver and The Flaming Lips Part 1:

Bon Iver and The Flaming Lips Part 2:

Erykah Badu and The Flaming Lips Part 1:

Erykah Badu and The Flaming Lips Part 2:

leahc@dose.ca

link.Abstract: The Grammy nominations were announced Wednesday, and Kanye West leads the pack. Find out who else is up for a Grammy February 12.
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: The Grammy nominations were announced Wednesday, and Kanye West leads the pack. Find out who else is up for a Grammy February 12.
link.title: Kanye West

link.Abstract: Consider it a sample of what you can expect on Grammy night, Feb. 12, 2012. The Grammy Nominations Concert took place Nov. 30, 2011 at L.A.'s Nokia Theatre. We've got photos from the event.
link.title: Photos: Inside the Grammy Nominations Concert

link.Abstract: From Taylor Swift's big win to Justin Bieber in Zubaz pants, we're looking back at the most memorable moments of the evening.
link.title: Best and Worst Moments from the AMAs

link.Abstract: Montreal was watching Kanye West and Jay-Z Nov. 22 when the two MCs brought their Watch the Throne tour to the Bell Centre. We've got photos. The Watch the Throne tour continues to Vancouver Dec. 17 and 18.
link.title: Photos: Watch The Throne in Montreal

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift's Speak Now World Tour is at its end. The country-pop star gave the first of two sold-out shows at New York's Madison Square Garden Nov. 21. We've got photos.
link.title: Photos: Taylor Swift at Madison Square Garden

link.Abstract: Selena Gomez! Lady Gaga! Coldplay! A dancing leprechaun! (Oops! That was actually Justin Bieber!) We've got pictures from the 2011 MTV Europe Music Awards, held Nov. 6 in Belfast, Ireland.
link.title: Photos: Inside the 2011 MTV Europe Music Awards

link.Abstract: Lady Gaga vows to channel her inner "Indian hippie" at a press conference in New Delhi.
link.title: Gallery: Lady Gaga in India

link.Abstract: Nicki Minaj is more than just a pretty face. She's also an angry face, a bonkers face ... we could go on. Here are some of the best examples from the MC's new video for "Till the World Ends."
link.title: Gallery: The Many Faces of Nicki Minaj

link.Abstract: Nip-slips, a turkey dinner and more nip-slips. That's how you celebrate Pink Friday! Nicki Minaj's Friday, Aug. 5 performance on Good Morning America was packed with surprises.
link.title: Photos: Nicki Minaj Does Good Morning America

link.Abstract: What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas...but we managed to smuggle out these photos. See pics of Nicki Minaj at the I Heart Radio music festival Sept. 24.
link.title: Photos: Nicki Minaj Plays I Heart Radio Fest

link.Abstract: Lady Gaga made out with Sting, did pilates on a motorcycle/keyboard and danced in her underwear. What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas...but we managed to smuggle out these photos. See pics of Gaga's Sept. 24 set at the I Heart Radio music festival.
link.title: Photos: Lady Gaga Plays I Heart Radio Fest
